> 
> People have come back from vacation so there wasn't much content to put in the devnotes that wasn't flat out spoiling the PS4 announcement. Thankfully I can say that the dev cycle on 1.0.3 is nearly done now, and you'll hear more as the week progresses.

Dude... I usually don't like to tell people how to do their job... but as somebody who has been a journalist for a respected newspaper for years and has delved into PR and is currently the main communication interface between our company and a lot of customers, I have to say something.

**Posting the PS4 announcement into Dev Notes is like walking into the labor room during birth and screaming "Look guys, I bought a new house!"**

This would have been news for the "Announcement" thread. 

Just a slight error, right? I am worried it is not. I am worried you deliberately misused the Dev Notes to get more attention, because you know that people read those the most. You have read some of the comments here. If my speculation is correct you have toyed with your own customers' expectations and (even more worrying) with their trust.

Dev Notes are for Dev Notes. It there are no news on development, then just write another "Slow News Day" Dev Note. Or say "no dev notes today". Use the appropriate channels for the appropriate content. Otherwise we could basically abandon the forum structure and moderation, because if you can post anything anywhere you want, why shouldn't we?

There is only one remedy:

**@Mods: Please move this thread to "Announcements" and rename it correctly. Thank you!**

Regarding the announcement:

I personally don't like Sony or the PS4 (would have preferred you going for ID@Xbox, especially with the ability to use PC Mods on Xbox One, as Bethesda has announced for Fallout 4), but I can understand your wish to expand your awareness and income. So good on you. I am not excited about Flying Tiger, but maybe they just don't have any good gameplay ideas and are sound code monkeys. Who knows? I am giving them the benefit of the doubt here. 

But being currently employed with a software development company, I am contesting your claim that outsourcing PS4 development will not affect PC development. I am pretty sure the devs will have to coordinate with Flying Tiger and / or show them how certain things are done or supposed to handle. As someone who wrote his thesis on a self developed usability test I am especially worried about that topic, since KSP is laid out for Mouse & Keyboard, so how could that be translated to a controller without being an abysmal user experience?

The next dev notes better be real dev notes.
